import json
from datetime import datetime

# Dictionary to store all counts
all_counts = {}
execution_time = datetime.now().isoformat()

try:
    # Define all tables to count
    tables_to_count = {
        "dim_date": "odw_harmonised_db.live_dim_date",
        "sap_hr_weekly":"odw_harmonised_db.load_sap_hr_weekly",
        "load_sap_hr": "odw_harmonised_db.load_sap_hr_monthly",
        "hist_sap_hr": "odw_harmonised_db.hist_SAP_HR",
        "sap_hr_leavers": "odw_harmonised_db.load_sap_hr_leavers", 
        "fact_absence_data": "odw_harmonised_db.sap_hr_fact_absence_all",
        "absence_data": "odw_harmonised_db.sap_hr_absence_all",
        "absence_data_sickness": "odw_harmonised_db.sap_hr_fact_absence_sickness",
        "protected_data": "odw_harmonised_db.sap_hr_protected_data",
        # Add all your other tables here
    }
    
    # Get counts for all tables
    for table_name, table_path in tables_to_count.items():
        try:
            count = spark.sql(f"SELECT COUNT(*) as count FROM {table_path}").collect()[0]['count']
            all_counts[table_name] = {
                "count": count,
                "table_path": table_path,
                "status": "success",
                "timestamp": execution_time
            }
            print(f"✓ {table_name}: {count} records")
        except Exception as e:
            all_counts[table_name] = {
                "count": 0,
                "table_path": table_path,
                "status": "error",
                "error": str(e),
                "timestamp": execution_time
            }
            print(f"✗ {table_name}: Error - {str(e)}")
    
    # Return as JSON string
    result_json = json.dumps(all_counts)
    mssparkutils.notebook.exit(result_json)
    
except Exception as e:
    error_result = {
        "status": "failed",
        "error": str(e),
        "timestamp": execution_time
    }
    mssparkutils.notebook.exit(json.dumps(error_result))
